page.title: 01 INTRODUCTION
page.content: Our area consists of a 12 kilometre block of rural Gloucestershire in the Severn Vale between Lower Apperley in the north and a small village called The Leigh in the south east. Much of the area is low lying below the 10 metre contour and is regularly flooded by the River Severn each winter.Lower Apperley lies on a spur of higher ground rising to 50 metres while The Leigh is situated on a knoll just over 15 metres high. The River Severn can only be crossed at one place between Gloucester and Tewkesbury at the Haw Bridge on the B4213 road.The A38 main road passes near The Leigh in the south east.
